definition: to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to strike the edge of the gong/(fig.) to stir the pot (i.e. cause or exacerbate a dispute)

sentences.english: The villagers beat drums and lit firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 村民们敲锣打鼓放鞭炮。

sentences.english: On news of approaching enemy aircraft a gong sounded to warn the inhabitants.
sentences.chinese: 当敌人飞机来临时用敲锣的方式通知民众。

sentences.english: There were old people , young people; they beat the drums through the day.
sentences.chinese: 其中有老人，也有年轻人，他们整天都在敲锣打鼓。

sentences.english: What, just for banging a gong?
sentences.chinese: 什么，仅仅因为我敲锣了？

sentences.english: There are dragon dances with drums.
sentences.chinese: 也会敲锣打鼓的舞龙灯。

sentences.english: The teacher rang a gong; it was time for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 老师开始敲锣，午饭时间到了。

sentences.english: Drumming is not the way to catch a hare.
sentences.chinese: 靠敲锣打鼓抓不到兔子。

sentences.english: In China, people may play the gong and the drum during the traditional festivals.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，人们在逢年过节时会敲锣打鼓。

definition: Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
to perform music/to play a tune
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
